website_summaries.verdict: Brome offers innovative designs in bird feeders that keep the squirrels at bay, and this impressive model seems to do the trick –worth the price.
pros: A rugged, squirrel-proof feeder with an impressive lifetime warranty
Has a cardinal perch, 6 ports, and capacity for more than 5 lbs
cons: Ports tend to close when large birds land on it, resulting in clogs
Swings a bit when hanging – some users have better results mounting it instead

customer_reviews.title: It only took the squirrels 10 days to bust it
customer_reviews.text: Just 10 days after hanging in the bird feeding garden, the squirrels chewed through a “hidden” plastic piece & the feeder was laying on the ground. Think the little red plastic piece was under the baffle, but they got to it. It was otherwise everything as advertised &!appeared sturdy &?well built. Maybe these critters are just smarter than the average rodent. The company refunded the purchase price. This was the third unsuccessful attempt at feeding the birds & not the squirrels. Finally got another which seems to be working, which leaves more seed for the chipmunks!
customer_reviews.author: martha rogers

customer_reviews.title: I have other squirrel buster products that I like. But after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This started out working very well. I have other squirrel buster products that I like. But after a few months, the weight of the feeder itself basically keeps the feeder “closed”. I have it set in the least sensitive setting (which would allow even heavier birds to feed on it), but that doesn’t help. It used to take a few days for the birds to empty it, but now it takes a good week, because they cannot get to the peanuts! Defiantly a disapppintment.
customer_reviews.author: Alyn York

customer_reviews.title: Poor engineering on the Squirrel Plus.
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be having the same problems as other customers. The birds seem to ignore this feeder. I have other Squirrel Buster brand feeders and they work fine. I use the same seed in the other feeders and they empty in a few days. This feeder's seed ports seem too "deep". The birds seem to become frustrated and will not return. I have changed the location but the feeding (s) did not increase. Poor engineering on the Squirrel Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Franzie

customer_reviews.title: Not squirrel or chew proof!
customer_reviews.text: One clever neighborhood squirrel figured this out in about 3 weeks then was able to chew through it on one try. Very nice design and I was very happy until squirrelmageddon. Amazingly all the squirrels learned the trick within a day, and they chewed through the "guaranteed 100% chew proof material". I give the feeder 2 stars because they are gracious enough to allow me to return the feeder. They need to redesign and come over to my squirrel testing grounds to evaluate it. I may give it another try in a harder to get to location.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it IS squirrel proof! Best quality feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best bird feeder I have purchased. I go through about 30LBs of birdseed/week. I committed years ago to feeding all seasonal and migrating birds year round. I also have lots of squirrels. During any given morning, more than a dozen squirrels will be foraging on the ground for seeds that the birds drop. They have tried jumping on and/or sliding down to the feeder to get at the seed but they have not been successful. I've used these feeders for years because they are sturdy, well designed, quality feeders.
customer_reviews.author: BRT356

customer_reviews.title: 10 STARS!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a LOT of squirrels running around our yard, and I have had a love/hate relationship with them because they would always break in, and literally destroy my bird feeders. Now... I can love the squirrels again (except when they dig up my new plants), because this Birdfeeder truly has been 100% squirrel proof for me. I even encourage the squirrels to try, just for laughs! LOLOL! Thank you Squirrel Buster for such a wonderful product! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.text: Functionality is not an issue. It does its job and does it well. But ... when the cleaning instructions say "dishwasher safe," do not read that to mean dishwasher safe. The painted parts came out dulled and blistered and the paint is now flaking off in junks. I would not call that dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful feeder. Squirrel proof
customer_reviews.text: Birds are not eating from this. I have tried various locations and they ignore it. I have the smaller version and they all love it. I bought this one for the larger birds, like cardinals and woodpeckers. Nothing is using this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mckeel

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bird Feeder I own!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 different feeders from 5 different manufacturers. I wanted to compare them to each other and see if they lived up to there claims. Squirrel buster plus was the Best by far....and with the Life warranty makes it the Best Buy ....by a long shot. It is well thought out....provides access to the seed for the birds....protects the seed from water.....holds lots of seed and squirrels are totally frustrated and leave it alone now. I even have a Yankee Droll with the power ring.....it is fun but has battery and mechanical problems. Great design and can be taken apart for cleaning. This is the best by far!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David E Ferens

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST FEEDER ON THE MARKET!!! Raccoons can’t open the twist on top!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding songbirds for 25 years and had over 4 dozen different types of birdfeeders and this is the absolute BEST bird feeder ever!!! It is super easy to clean and fill. Holds 5 lbs of seed. And, best of all, the ring pulls down to close access to the seed ports to squirrels attempting to invade your feeders. You can also adjust the weight to allow, or NOT, for birds such as doves!!😍
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Madison

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This a tough, durable, functional and attractive bird feeder that absolutely keeps squirrels from emptying your feeder. Even if they they the "jump on and shake it loose" they can't hold on long enough to do damage. Spend the money on this feeder, it's well worth it. This is my third one (for three different properties, not because they wear out) and I have given them as gifts as well. We will arrive at our lake house after being absent a couple weeks, and there are still plenty of seeds in the feeder. In my experience, this is the best squirrel proof feeder for the price. And, most importantly, the birds love it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking; buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this particular feeder for over 10 years. The first one was destroyed by the deer in our neighborhood when I left it out overnight. (Bring your feeders in at night if possible). The Squirrel Buster feeders are the best by a long shot. One doesn't need to elaborate on the topic as their advertising team does a better job than I could ever hope to accomplish. Know this: I'm just a regular retired guy whom wants to help others make good purchasing decisions. Stop looking; buy this feeder. A little pricey, but it will last a lifetime if you protect it from deer.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Stops squirrels and large birds
customer_reviews.text: I've spent too much money on bird feeders that don't stop squirrels--or if they do, they fall apart. I had a "cage" type where one of the perches fell off, plus cardinals could not fit inside. This bird feeder thwarts squirrels, large birds including those nasty European starlings, and lets my cardinals eat. The spring action closes up the holes nicely when something heavy appears. Yes, it is expensive, but so far well worth it. I was spending more than $14 a week on seed (mostly eaten by large birds and squirrels) so the feeder will pay for itself in about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels hate it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a study bird feeder and truly frustrates the local squirrel community. It’s easy to assemble and adjust tension so that only small birds (and no squirrels) can enjoy their meals. I purchased my first one five years ago and after enduring relentless, but failing attacks by squirrels and being left out in the elements year round, it needed to be replaced. The squirrels are all gathered on our fence right now with protest signs as I ready my new Squirrel Buster feeder. Sorry guys, but you’ll need to go somewhere else for your meals!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the Squirrel Buster Plus is a Hit
customer_reviews.text: The Squirrel buster Plus has been a great success at my house. We mounted it on a lamp that we had removed all the electrical paraphernalia from. My husband bolted it to the deck. The squirrel could still climb the pole but he couldn't get any seed. I started spraying the pole with WD 40 and watched the squirrel slide down the pole over and over again. Then we bought the seed catcher. I thought it would keep the squirrels out without the WD40. It took the squirrel a while but he finally got into the pan. Now I still have to spray the pole. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I honestly DO NOT know what to think of this feeder. I got it for obvious reasons... keeping the squirrels at bay and the quality craftsmanship.... but... the birds will not eat from it. I have moved it twice..tried 2 different types of food.. after a month I finally saw 1 chickadee and 1 female cardinal. ONCE.... not repeatedly. All the birds use my other feeders. I've checked the ports repeatedly and the seed is there. I've decided I would have to remove all my other feeders to force them to this one and I'm not going to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Gamma

customer_reviews.title: Defeats seed thieves!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder works as advertised! Easy to fill and clean. It has held up very well to weather extremes and sun. The seed tube has remained clear and scratch-free. We had so many squirrels stealing the seeds and keeping the birds away from the feeders, but they can't get any seeds from this one. I really felt bad for an ambitious racoon who got his paw stuck when the port closed on it. He eventually freed himself by causing it to open with all his gyrations. Thank goodness! Expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I’ve just purchased my second one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent feeder, provides seed with virtually not incidental bird or squirrel caused spillage. I now have two of these feeders, I purchased my first one almost two years ago. I use one feeder for high quality variety seeds and the other strictly for black sunflower seeds. I suspended the feeders under a medal dome baffle hanging from a 6ft shepherd hook type metal pole. Squirrels have zero success getting any of the seed and watching their antics trying to solve the shutdown mechanism is an additional entertainment. I highly recommend these feeders!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: One word - Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my parents as a gift since my mom loves watching the birds outside her kitchen window. Unfortunately, squirrels also love the bird feed that they put out for them. To battle that, they had tried several other feeders to deter those furry rats! Nothing was working for them and those little buggers would always grab the seed and scare the birds. After they put this beast up in their yard, they've had no issues with squirrels! Although they are clever and will get on the base of the bird feeder the mechanism keeps it shut so they can't grab any seed. It works really well and keeps the bird seed for just that, the birds!
customer_reviews.author: Wombat

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: This bird feeder is wonderful! It was on the expensive side, but we were desperate for a feeder that was truly squirrel proof! The first week or so, we kept finding the rubber ring on the ground, and we thought it was not very well designed. But then, we caught the culprits (two squirrels) taking it down by their weight! We just kept putting it back up. Within another week, they got the message that the seed was blocked off whether they were able to balance on the ring or not! Beautiful! An amazing concept, even as larger birds are still able to access the seed! We are enjoying watching our birds, uninterrupted, everyday now!
customer_reviews.author: Penny G

customer_reviews.title: Best bird feeder ever!
customer_reviews.text: We had problems for years with the squirrels pillaging our bird feeders. This feeder has completely baffled the squirrels. They have have trying and trying but cannot get the bird seed. I think they’ve actually gotten depressed and given up. One squirrel just sat on a branch yesterday and stared at it with a forlorn look. We used to have to refill the feeder every other day. Now, because it’s just birds eating, we fill it once every 4-5 days. This is the best bird feeder ever.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: excellent feeder
customer_reviews.text: this was my second Brome feeder. I wish I had bought this large one first but anyway I love this feeder and will order another. Birds have easy access plus seems to keep rain out better than the small ones. But the best part is I'm not having to fill it every day. I know it's seems expensive but is is so much better than other feeders. Customer service is great, I talked with them about parts for my old feeder and they were very helpful. Don't mess with other feeders this is the best. Just ask my feathered friends!
customer_reviews.author: russ2yall

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC FEEDER!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a great feeder that deterred squirrels, was less messy, and made the birds happy. This has been a wonderful purchase. The deterrent totally works (sorry squirrels!). I tightened the spring so it wouldn’t deter the jays though, and it worked! It took a couple of days for the birds to get used to a new feeder, and I was worried for a minute, but now there is a steady stream of them happy to dive in. Couldn’t be more pleased. It is a quality purchase! I plan to get one (either the medium or small size) for my mother-in-law.
customer_reviews.author: eebees

customer_reviews.title: Clear Plastic Part Scratches and Discolors
customer_reviews.text: If the company offered the 'cardinal ring' on their smaller, less expensive products it would be great. This one came in with paper glued to the middle clear plastic part. Whatever glue they used would not come off, and using a non-abrasive 'goo' remover scratched it. It scratches very easily, and is made of a material that will discolor over time in the sun, like some of the less expensive units they sell. It's really too big a feeder for what I want, but I wanted the cardinal ring. It would have been better if I modified their less expensive smaller units as many have done to add a makeshift cardinal perch.
customer_reviews.author: Petenpete

customer_reviews.title: Great First Impression
customer_reviews.text: Impressed upon arrival. Well made = Like that I can adjust the tension of the "close" bar so that bigger (greedy) birds cannot access. Like the fact that there is a venting system so that the seeds can breathe. Took me a minute to figure out how to attach "cardinal ring" but that is because I didn't read the instructions LOL. Easy Peasy once I had! Like the fact that there are no electronics involved (I have a Droll Yankee Spinner) so that I don't have to worry about recharging. Will update this review after I have used a while.
customer_reviews.author: Boonmah

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite bird feeder. Squirrels and starlings were destroying and emptying my other feeders daily. I filled others advise and purchased the pole attachment( fits 1 inch conduit purchased at Lowe’s) and the clear plastic rain shield to protect the seed openings from the weather. I then switched to black sunflower seeds to attract cardinals and finches. Last thing, helped by feeder design, was adjust the tension in perch birds sit on to allow only small birds to feed. Anything heavier, and the openings close. ( Wingnut on bottom of feeder does this) Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: simply the best feeder and warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding birds for many years and this is the best feeder I have ever bought. I can't think of one negative to list. Most importantly after being in the elements of the northeast for 8 years and attacked by squirrels daily the wear and tear was obvious. I contacted Brome customer care and they sent me free of charge 4 new parts which included seed tube. Their lifetime warranty was backed 100% and the price is worth every dollar. Just buy it for being a great feeder and great company.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-NJ

customer_reviews.title: It really is Squirrel-proof, but it's difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can finally see the birds in front of my window. The squirrels still come but to eat the seeds that fall on the ground. They can't climb and eat them from the bird-feeder. The only problem is that it's too difficult to clean, but I guess it's a small price I have to pay for not having the frustration of seeing the squirrels steal the seeds from the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel proof and bird proof
customer_reviews.text: On a plus side the squirrels don’t bother with this, but neither do the birds. We’ve experimented with all kinds of resistance settings but whatever we try the seed ports are barely a quarter open and the birds mostLy ignore it. The seed molds and solidifies very fast and it is impossible to empty the old seed out without disassembling the feeder and prizing out the whole moldy mess. A waste of money and seed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen LR

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!! Squirrels are GONE!
customer_reviews.text: After literally years of squirrels all over the feeder, emptying it out, scaring away all the birds, I have WON!! Yes, this is not inexpensive, but feeding squirrels high quality seed is not either. I used to refill almost every day, and now the seed lasts several days. The first day I hung this out, it was just a riot to watch the squirrel being so frustrated, perched on top of the pole above the feeder, chasing all the birds away for hours, screeching at them. Then he tried to get the seeds. No way could he get to them. I recommend bird lovers with squirrel problems to get this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: cinderella

customer_reviews.title: No squirrels on this feeder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this birdfeeder so that I have a feeder that I wouldn’t have to police for squirrels. I completely met my expectations. Squirrels tried to get on it at first but they realized it was not gonna work for them and they gave up. The food does get jammed up at the bottom every now and then but I just turn it upside down and everything sort of realigns. It seems to be of good quality and though it’s a little bit on the expensive side I think it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worth spending extra for this
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this for a week and a half or so, but I’m thrilled with it already. We tried everything to keep the squirrels out of our bird feeder with no success before giving in and purchasing a more expensive bird feeder. Numerous squirrels have tried, but zero have succeeded in getting into our bird seed with this feeder. We were refilling a bird feeder with nearly the same capacity weekly. We’ve filled this once so far (about 10 days ago) and its only about half empty.
customer_reviews.author: Chester421

customer_reviews.title: Brome Squirrel Buster Plus and the folks at Brome are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy install. The Squirrel Buster Plus manufacturing was very well thought out. Assembly and disassembly is a breeze. As soon as I pole mounted it, some Sandhill cranes came by and checked it out. Sorry Sandhills Not for you. I'm looking forward to seeing the birds enjoying this addition. The company videos are great and easy to follow. Spokeswoman Tatiana Thomson is great on these videos and explains everything very clearly. The website is helpful and interactive. They even have a bird photo contest!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Most perfect feeder ever
customer_reviews.text: This is truly squirrel 🐿 proof. 💯 perfect. I’ve had it up 2 months and not one squires has gotten into it. I have used with a dome above it but the cost has saved me in feed, and the birds have love it. We live across from the lake and get high winds. It has been the best feeder ever. They though of everything with this feeder. You won’t regret the investment. The large size feeder home enough feed for about a month at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Expensive waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well built, although I don't care for the screw on top. The reason for the 1 star rating is the birds won't go near it. I should have returned it, but I kept it against my better judgment thinking eventually they'd get used to it. Occasionally, a house finch will eat from it, but nothing larger. I guess I shouldn't be too upset, its more than paid for itself in money I haven't had to spend on birdseed.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: YEAH!  Squirrel
customer_reviews.text: This is the first feeder that our squirrels have not been able to destroy, detach from the tree, or get food out of. They have stopped trying. Instead they eat the birdseed I put on a rock on the ground especially for them. It has not however been able to deter the deer from emptying it in one evening (of course I could raise the feeder, but then I have to climb a ladder to refill it, which usually involves some snow on the ground) Hope leaving the front lights on might keep them away- we'll see
customer_reviews.author: Gary Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy feeder. I doubt my squirrels will be able to figure this one out as the top is secured nicely. The perch is adjustable by weight of the bird. Feeder comes adjusted and I have not had to adjust it further. I have cardinals, sparrows, finches, wrens and a few more smaller birds that feed nicely. I appreciate the amount that it holds as well. I feed about every other day. Nice item!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC - as advertised
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like. I have a ton of squirrels in my yard. the only birdseed they get is anything that falls to the ground when I fill it. The unit is attractive, durable, can be washed in the machine, was easy to install and easy to fill. Mine is up on a tree limb so I have to climb a ladder but it's still a piece of cake. The birds love it. I'm buying another one. Customer service is incredible. I was missing a small part, contacted them, and I had it within three days.
customer_reviews.author: Roses in Grayslake

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: I have run the gamut of bird feeders, constantly being disappointed and frustrated, but this baby does the trick. I have watched the squirrels try their best to get in it and they have failed every time. Trust me, they are pretty ingenious. Now they're relegated to just picking up whatever scraps the birds leave. I love it. This is for small to medium size birds. I've been telling everyone I know about this feeder. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Squirrel Deterrent Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder. And, it does deter the squirrels. And, our seed budget has been dramatically reduced. Importantly, delivery was fast, packaged nicely, and included great instructions. Everything has worked perfectly on this well made feeder. Take note, the seed and or seed mix is important; at first we filled it with a nut and seed mix that had a few cut up prune mixed in. These actually gummed up the feeder so that the other seed would not go down properly....our mistake. Anyway, this is a great feeder and worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Baccari

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, birds love it.
customer_reviews.text: Had it up for about one week. The birds LOVE it. I actually dont know how I'm going to keep up with the bird feed expense. I didn't expect it to be such a hit. The birds took to it on the first day and are all over it all the time. I have seen a squirrel try to eat from it and fail more than once. So that's good! Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi P.

customer_reviews.title: My second unit...better than ever
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I'm sorry to say that this product is now made in China. But the quality control is as good as ever. The Squirrel Buster Plus is well thought out and well made. The birds love it and the Squirrels are as frustrated as ever.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: No Squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I debated for a while whether I wanted to spend this much for a bird feeder. The entertainment value alone as been fun. For the first week watching the squirrels try to figure it out was great. Best of all it works. Now that it has been up for a month they will occasionally get in the dead tree I use as a holder and just stare at it. You almost see their brains trying to figure different point of attack. Once in a while one will try to take the top off but get frustrated and leaves. I fill it with black oil sunflower seeds and have no issues. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has plenty of capacity and a squirrel excluding feature that keeps them OUT. The feeder is mechanically a bit complicated, so cleaning is something of a chore until one gets used to it. That said, this is my second feeder of this type and the manufacturer has made it much easier to clean. If you want to feed birds and not squirrels, this is the one to get. P.S. they offer a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gaboda

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder but not for cardinals
customer_reviews.text: We love almost everything about this feeder BUT it is true that the "cardinal ring" does not solve the problem for male cardinals. The ring is simply not far enough from the openings for them to feed comfortably, as they have to sit sideways and their necks are not flexible. This could be solved by making the perches 1/2" longer and the ring correspondingly farther from the feeder. My other objection is that even this largest size is too small. We have several and nonetheless have to fill them every other day. I'd like one with twice the capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Acadadvice

customer_reviews.title: They do work, bye bye squirrels :)
customer_reviews.text: Love these bird feeders! I bought 2 sizes a large one and a small one. They are a bit expensive but hopefully will last a long time. Easy to add seed too and very sturdy. Love watching the squirrels try to get seed. Although they've pretty much given up and now just eat the leftovers of the ground. In the photo I have my old bird feeder and the first squirrel buster I bought. They still kept going for the old feeder. So I bought another The King size.. love them both!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the monsters out!
customer_reviews.text: In addition to squirrels, I've been fending off hordes of grackles that descend like vultures and terrorize the smaller birds. They can't get a grip on the perches of this feeder and, after many unsuccessful attempts to dine on the fly, have pretty much given up on it. Same with the squirrels... they can get on top of it, but the top is too small and slippery for them to get a good purchase, and when they try to dangle by their hind feet, they quickly discover that they're too short to reach the seed ports. Then they fall off! The larger size also means I don't have to refill as often. A winner all around and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Withstands the test of time!
customer_reviews.text: 2 1/2 years ago I decided to bite the bullet and purchase this feeder rather than continue to waste $30-$40 dollars on "squirrel proof" feeders that only fool the squirrels for a few months. Not for a lack of trying, those pesky squirrels CANNOT break through this one. You can see where they have chewed their hearts out trying to figure it out. Every so often, a new visitor spends several days trying, then eventually gives up. If you want to feed the birds and not the squirrels, just invest in this feeder and save money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: nray57

customer_reviews.title: Not durable but Customer Service made it right!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has been very effective at keeping the squirrels away. They can’t win, no matter how hard they try! I’m very disappointed though in it’s durability though. I bought it in February ‘18 & yesterday (8/13/19), the bottom section fell off the feeder. There was only a plastic rod holding the whole thing together. I’ve always handled the feeder carefully so there was no operator error. This feeder cost too much money to only get 1 1/2 years use. Boo! 9/2/19 GREAT NEWS!! I reached out to the customer service department of the manufacturer and they sent me a replacement part at no charge. My feeder is back in service and I am happy again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not Squirrel Proof
customer_reviews.text: NOT squirrel proof. My squirrels would swing it around and the seed would rain all over the ground. I called brome and they suggested that I return it. They said it isn't really 100% guaranteed to be squirrel proof.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie M.

customer_reviews.title: It really is squirrel proof!!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this birdfeeder I haven’t seen any squirrels even try and about three days at first they were trying everything and couldn’t figure it out and I have it set so I can feed the larger birds but the squirrels cannot get to it! Finally a real squirrel proof birdfeeder! :-) I feed the Squirrels but I feed them in the back of the house and the birdfeeder is in the front of the house. I would and will definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: allison dukes

customer_reviews.title: This solved my grackle problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this feeder because every spring large flocks of grackles move through. They drive out all the smaller birds and wipe out my feeder, which can hold 7 lbs of sunflower seeds, in a day. This has worked perfectly. I set the weight so that it closes for grackles and obviously they are very smart because after about 20 seconds of trying, they give up - and also tell all their friends not to bother. It's a great feeder for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer88

customer_reviews.title: Outsmarts squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sister who hadn't been able to keep squirrels out of her bird feeders. This one was the top rated one I found when searching for ratings. Although the squirrels tried and tried to defeat this one, they failed. A raccoon even took this feeder off the hook and carried it down the hill from her house but couldn't get it open. So far it is squirrel proof although there are squirrels out there determined to defeat any squirrel proof bird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Pole Mountable?
customer_reviews.text: The description of this device says that it is "Pole-mountable". Unfortunately the only way this device is pole-mountable is if you purchase a separate device to allow it to be mounted on a pole. No where is this said on the page for the feeder. The device for pole mounting costs an extra $20. Very poor description...buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Ok birdfeeder - Replacing the one I have
customer_reviews.text: After many years, I'm replacing my Squirrel Buster Bird Feeder. In addition to years worth of squirrel attacks and the occasional bear, I'm buying another of these bird feeders. Just remember to have at least an 18 inch distance from anything squirrels can launch from. Heck, my smart squirrels have jumped from a nearby and attacked the bird feeder from above.
customer_reviews.author: Techtao

customer_reviews.title: Large birdfeeder, will keep out some non-birds
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a birdfeeder that was large (to hold a lot of seed) and would keep squirrels and other non-birds out of the seed. This fits the bill, but I forgot about deer! The feeder makes no claims to keep out deer of course who stand next to the feeder and get to the seeds. I just forgot how rampant deer are in my area. Our solution is to hang it higher, out of the reach of deer.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON MILLS

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, when they say lifetime warranty, they mean it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 this style one I bought in 2008, the Cardinal ring fell apart 5 years later, I called to see if I could buy a replacement, they told me it had a lifetime warranty and sent me a new one completely free in the new design they dont even charge postage. I just found a crack in the seed tube (it was thrown to the ground during hurricane Harvey) and they sent me a new seed tube for free, over 10 years later, I will never buy a different brand, these are worth every penny, and the birds love them, the squirrels not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Wild bird lover

customer_reviews.title: Birds don't like small feeder holes
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this got so many great reviews. I've had it hanging on one side of my home for three weeks now and it is still half full of the seeds I put in when I got it. The other feeder on the other side of my home , which takes almost the same amount of seeds empties in a little over two days. The birds don't like sticking thier heads in the feeder holes. I really wanted this feeder to work but I'm going to send it back today. ....It is squirrel proof though.
customer_reviews.author: Edward long

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Bird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and will probably buy at least one more. I also have several of the older, smaller versions. They are all great bird feeders. Someone spent a lot of time trying to make these feeders enticing to birds, and easy to clean and refill. I live in an area prone to rain once in a while, so prefer this version with a weather guard. As far as I'm concerned, you can't go wrong with anything this company sells for bird feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Actually worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This has transformed my deck from a squirrel feeding area to a bird feeding area. The squirrels don't even bother to try it anymore, and it attracts a TON of birds. I fill it with sunflower hearts to cut down on the mess from hulls. I also bought the peanut feeder by the same company and am seeing two different species of woodpecker on a daily basis. They are pricey, but not that much pricier than others and the squirrel deterrent works super well. I did not make any adjustment to the factory tension settings and it lets all birds in and keeps all squirrels out.
customer_reviews.author: MsElaineous

customer_reviews.title: Parts will not stay together.  Huge waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This expensive bird feeder will not stay together. The posts screw in and the birds turning on the posts causing them to unscrew and fall to the ground. The green cardinal ring does not stay on either and falls to the ground. This is the worst design I have ever had the displeasure of owning. Of course you can't tell all this from the picture. I deserve a refund but I have gone past the deadline for returns.
customer_reviews.author: marti lofton

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel proof
customer_reviews.text: It was a little expensive compared to other models, but it got the job done. The squirrels actually got frustrated and left! It's easy to fill, but a little more difficult to clean than other models. It holds about 5lbs. One thing I do miss; but I guess you can't have it all; is the ability to layer the seed at different levels. When there were more feeding holes, smaller birds could eat Niger seed from above while larger birds could eat sunflower from below. Overall a very sturdy unit, that does the job as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: waryconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Stops Squirrels from Eating Your High Priced Bird Food.
customer_reviews.text: It has been in the yard for several years now, and was a very good investment. It stopped the squirrels as promised by locking them out. Most of them have given up and leave it alone now. But there is an occasional rogue that wants to take a shot at it....only to fail. It is comical to watch them try and figure out how to get into it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Weidert

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Like many who have put out bird feeders, I have bought several that were advertised as squirrel-proof. Not that I have anything theoretically against squirrels, but I do put out my feeders for birds, eh? I have had this for nearly a month. Squirrels look at it, try to get in, and abandon the attempt. So far, none of them has managed to defeat it. My only complaints are that it's expensive, and that it doesn't hold a great deal of birdseed. If you have many birds using it, you have to refill it pretty frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Arno Vosk

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone told me that there was no such thing as a squirrel proof feeder, well they were wrong. When I first got this feeder, it was funny watching the squirrels "try" to get seed out of it. Hilarious!! Now they have given up and are back to eating seed off the ground. I love this feeder...it looks nice and definitely keeps the squirrels away!! I also bought the plastic squirrel guard more as an "umbrella" for the birds than to keep the squirrels off because they don't even bother anymore. The birds and I are very happy with both of these products!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep out all rodents!
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels couldn't feed, but the rats came out at night, climbed the skinny metal pole, and dropped down and fed. They are small, and weigh about the same as a bird, so their weight doesn't trigger the feeding hole to shut. I thought removing the cardinal ring would help, but they are persistent. I finally resolved it by tilting the pole over the pool. They are too scared to creep out there. Problem solved, but it looks silly. Yes, I changed to safflower seeds only, but they like those too.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feeder - not easy to clean which you will do after each good rain
customer_reviews.text: I've had one for over 8 years, and I've mostly enjoyed it. Yes is it is squirrel proof as I've had several try and get seeds only to leave with great frustration on the part of the squirrels. My complaint is that is is difficult to clean. After a rain storm you will find the seed gets crusted and stuck in ventilation holes and other hard to reach areas of the lower section. Perhaps a rain shield is the answer. My 8+ feeder has paint chipping off and other wear but it still holds seed, and its the best I can find so far for preventing squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Pecan Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Rodent proof but takes a beating form the critters
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has a good design to keep out the critters, however after a year's use the plastic piece that allows the sliding of the base up and down to keep out the critters has failed. Also this feeder must be securely anchored to a post because the raccoons and such will knock it down and drag it along the ground trying to get to the seed. I think there is a replacement part warranty on this so hopefully for a $90.00 feeder we can have it repaired or replaced. I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Hallmark reader

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Mooney
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a tray style feeder because after two years the squirrels figured out a path...and once they do that, it's constant attacks on the feeder. I like the ring instead of individual perches because the closing mechanism works better. There is about a one week learning curve for the cardinals, chickadee and tufted titmouse, but once they get used to the feeder they love it. There's a quicker learning curve for the squirrels...after three days they just gave up and haven't returned.
customer_reviews.author: Basin Brother

customer_reviews.title: Had this feeder for 10 years and loved it
customer_reviews.text: It appears that raccoons or some clever animals ran off with it, so I bought the exact same feeder. You can clean it in the dishwasher, it has various options so you can attract different types of birds. It is made of multiple replaceable parts and customer service is awesome. They have replaced several parts and gave me a solution so the new one does not disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Izzie Fred

customer_reviews.title: my birds refused to use this feeder
customer_reviews.text: My birds will not use this feeder. It stays full for weeks, using the same kind of food as the feeder mentioned below. I also have this feeder which my birds absolutely love: Squirrel Buster Classic Squirrel-proof Bird Feeder w/4 Feeding Ports, 2.4-pound Seed Capacity I have had no problems with squirrels eating the seed from either one but had to install baffles to keep the squirrels from jumping onto the feeders and scaring the birds away. They even shinny up the pole to get to them.
customer_reviews.author: liketoshop

customer_reviews.title: Eliminating every squirrel
customer_reviews.text: After a bear broke the “twirl and squirrel” feeder, I decided to try something cheaper notwithstanding the entertainment value of watching them get thrown off the feeder. I was concerned about how it would work (weight of animal closes access) to feeding holes) as I enjoy the cardinals and Blue Jays. The always industrious squirrels tried several days to gain access, but always failed and after 3 weeks have given up entirely. They wait patiently on the ground for smaller birds to spit seeds at them. I still have the Cardinals, but not as many Blue Jays. Woodpeckers love it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Their smaller feeders did not look squirrel-proof to me because of their surrounding cages, so I ordered this one despite it's size. Turns out it's not too big at all. The squirrels have tried, failed, and given up. The birds love it. It's well-designed, sturdy, and the best feeder I've ever owned. Update on May 6, 2020. We liked this feeder so much we bought a second one for a different side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: elke

customer_reviews.title: Bye-bye you little bastards
customer_reviews.text: Good gravy I've never been so tormented by any Critter like I have a squirrel! I ended up grabbing him and taking him down to a nice wooded location, thank goodness. So far so good! No squirrels. I had to take a gain detergent pod pierce it open and squirt it up the tree branch and that deterred the squirrels enough to get them to give up trying to jump on the feeder. My God what a pain in the butt critter a squirrel is!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Truly squirrelPROOF feeder! Awesome company!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this feeder for over 4 years & it is awesome! The squirrels have never been able to beat it & I have a LOT of squirrels! After a little while they quit even trying! I love that I can adjust the tension to keep out not only squirrels but crows & mourning doves while still allowing cardinals, woodpeckers & all smaller birds to eat. After a couple of years of year round use the spring mechanism got stretched & I couldn't tighten the tension enough. I called the company & they sent me a replacement part for free, no questions asked. This feeder was definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: My friend is head over heels for this thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a friend, and she gushes over how much she loves to watch the birds. It has a clever anti-squirrel system so you don't have to worry about thieves. If only my mom had one. She wouldn't have had to trap the squirrels and drive them across the river in the trunk of her town car.....
customer_reviews.author: Bad Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Be aware of one thing
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels gave up after several attempts at robbing seeds/nuts. Recommend getting the weather shield for this in order to keep snow and rain from getting into the feeder openings. You have to read the instructions carefully to find the squeeze clips which allow the base to be removed to put on the rain/snow guard. With that in place birds have full winter access.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Best Bird Feeder EVer!!!!!  Squirrels get so frustrated with this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like the Squirrel Buster Plus!!!!! Owner of 6. The ONLY Bird Feeder that keeps squirrels out. The squirrels get so frustrated running around it looking for entry until they either fall off or give up. Live up on a mountain and no matter the weather this things works and keeps the squirrels out. Have gifted it and the receiver wished they knew about it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: SkyTop

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for squirrel control!
customer_reviews.text: I like putting food out for the birds and watching them fly around, but I was frustrated by how the squirrels would come and knock over my previous feeder and make a mess, depriving the cute little birds of their supper. I thought I would give this feeder a try, and so far it has worked great. It is easy to fill and you can see from far away when you need to refill. The squirrels have been frustrated by failing to break it open or knock it down. And now my little birds eat to their heart's content. Everyone is happy (except the squirrels)!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated Squirrels
customer_reviews.text: After watching the squirrels take over our old bird feeder, we had to do something different. All our attempts at protecting our feeder were useless against the rodents. So we invested in the Squirrel Buster, hoping it would make a difference. It has done very well. The squirrels can't find a way to get down to the bird perch. They just climb across our horizontal pole to top of the feeder, and become frustrated. They scratch and chew on the feeder lid, but all to no avail. They have finally stopped even trying. Now they just find the seeds on the ground below the feeder, where the birds drop them. We are very satisfied with this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: deltaman

customer_reviews.title: Starling buster
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't allow starlings to feed which was my goal. BUT its a real pain to keep the feeing ports clear and a huge hassle to clean the feeder. The seeds clump together and clog the ports . I use a small stick in the ports to try to break up the clumps, which works for a few weeks. Then you have to clean it and its an unpleasant job to get the seed clumps cleared out. Disassemble part of it, soak it overnight, then try to get into and behind the ports. What an ordeal!
customer_reviews.author: HarrisHawk

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Birdfeeder Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but so worth it! I’ve been enjoying watching hundreds of birds enjoying this feeder. The only time I see squirrels feeding is from bird feed I’ve dropped on the ground. I love the large quantity of bird feed this feeder holds and the way it keeps bird feed dry with our wet/rainy days. Very, very pleased with this bird feeder, definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Big bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bird feeder with high expectations. It met all of them. It is a huge bird feeder though. So far the squirrels haven't found a way to get food out. I don't have to refill it all of the time like the old feeder. It lasts up to two weeks on one fill. It's easy to fill, and adjust. Very smart design. Ever piece has been well thought out

customer_reviews.title: It’s definitely squirrel-proof!
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to hang a bird feeder in my backyard (city) I had no clue where to start so I did a bunch of research and came upon this one. It’s very pricey, and I wasn’t sure if I needed this level of feeder but it got the best reviews so I went for it. Glad I did! Squirrels definitely can’t get the feed. I haven’t seen any actual birds on it yet but I have high hopes. And at least the squirrels won’t be eating the feed!
customer_reviews.author: J. McIntire

customer_reviews.title: no more squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: I like these feeders,, I have two, because it keeps the bird food for the birds and not the squirrels. Easy to fill, clean and hang. Cons: The cardinal ring sits too far back for the chickadees and black caps. Great for larger birds, not so for the tinier birds. Not all birds will like the feeders. Just because I like it doesn't mean they will like it. I have the smaller version of this feeder and all the birds like it. Bigger is not always better
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Fix for loose pegs and falling cardinal ring.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bird feeder except for the pegs that would constantly loosen up and allow the cardinal ring to fall off. My husband who by his own admission is not at all handy asked if wrapping the pegs with tape would help. I decided to try it before moving on to my elaborate idea for fixing it. What do you know? He is handy after all. Wrap the screw end of the peg with two layers of masking tape and screw it into place. It tightens them up just enough that the birds landing and taking off doesn't loosen them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Perry

customer_reviews.title: Dove Proof!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this out a few hours, and i expect it to take the cardinals a while to try it. The greatest satisfaction thus far has been watching my flock of white winged dove discover that they cannot get anything. I'm all for contributing to their full tummies, in moderation, but not to the tune of 2 or more pounds of seed a day. Plus, they are so heavy that with all of them trying to crowd onto my other feeder at once, seed spills and they always eventually break the perch. Hopefully, the cardinals will give this a try soon.
customer_reviews.author: Oma

customer_reviews.title: Really IS squirrel-proof
customer_reviews.text: This is the third squirrel buster we have owned over 15 years. It attracts a broad range of colorful birds here in eastern Long Island, but squirrels, raccoons and who-knows-what else have been foiled by its tricky design. When any pressure is applied to the base, the holes close up, making the seeds inaccessible. The top keeps out rain and snow and screws on securely.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Feeder. Well, at least it was!
customer_reviews.text: Both we and our local birds were thoroughly enjoying our Squirrel Buster Plus until this morning when a large black bear sauntered in. The bear stood on his hind legs and grabbed the very sturdy ten foot metal pole holding the feeder and pulled it to toward him. Then he grabbed the feeder and took off with it into the forest. Our expense bird feeder pole is destroyed and its feeder is gone. We got it all on our security camera and it is not fun to watch. So disappointing. Wife is in tears over it. Lesson learned. No feeder out when bears are out of hibernation.
customer_reviews.author: bestbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder backed by a great conversation
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic bird feeder! It's very amusing to watch the squirrels attempt to get to the food and get twarted everytime! It took a few days but now we have lots of birds enjoying it. And what a great company! We had a couple of broken things and they sent them right to us. It's expensive but definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: MBK OTR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic in Phoenix Arizona
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Have two. I dialed them in so finches can eat but not doves. I placed them away from the house, like 50’. Under the shade of a tree. The seeds that fall to the ground are for the doves and quails. Finches eat like there is no tomorrow. Transformed my backyard into a much better place.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Or maybe the squirrels west of Philly are just super aggressive!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder would not hold. Squirrels had become so used to getting into the feed before that was there that they aggressively attacked this one. they repeated knocked it to the ground and after a few times it broke from being knocked down. If you have a feeder in place that squirrels have become accustomed to being fed at, I am not sure that anything will truly discourage them from getting the food. Or maybe the squirrels west of Philly are just super aggressive!
customer_reviews.author: C Struebing

customer_reviews.title: The Squirrel Buster feeds finches, not squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I bought my first one, but after a couple weeks I was impressed enough to buy a second Squirrel Buster plus a Peanut feeder made by the same company. These feeders work exactly as advertised--the squirrels (and band-tail pigeons) are locked out while hoards of finches, chickadees, titmice, towhees and others feast on sunflower seeds throughout the day. And, while feasting, they sing---love it!!! The peanut feeder is frequented by acorn woodpeckers, a pair of bluejays, and the chickadees like to go back and forth between the feeders. Very highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Flippin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for just about a year and not 1 squirrel even attempted to use it. I've had squirrel proof feeders before and they were able to chew through the plastic tube at some bad design point or it was mountable to a tree and the squirrel just hung onto the tree and reached into little holes without applying the pressure needed to depress lever and keep them out (how naive of me). This one, hung from a tall plant hook works like a charm. I just have to remember to get it in every night so the bears don't rip it down. It's not bear proof :) !
customer_reviews.author: noreen

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels still hungry
customer_reviews.text: It is so entertaining to watch the squirrels look at the food and try to get into it, but they have been fooled every time. They have tried from the top and the side with no luck. The chickadees love it, and the cardinals and wrens are enjoying it, too. Bluejays eat off the ground mostly from what we have noticed (the chickadees throw out the corn looking for sunflower seeds). This is the birdfeeder brand I wil recommend to others. Bigger than expected, but great feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Cee Cee

customer_reviews.title: Also Bird Proof
customer_reviews.text: I really like this feeder..EXCEPT..in the spring I have a lot of different kinds of birds. As it gets warmer here come the Starlings and Crows. All my other birds disappear and the only thing I have are Starlings and Crows. I wrote the company and they offered no solutions to my problem. As soon as the bird food is empty I’m going to take feeder down and hopefully I will be able to purchase some kind of fencing material I can put around it to keep large birds out.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!! We m happy. Squirrels are not.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!! I have wanted this for years. It works!! Update: 6/18- a raccoon took down my feeder last night. All the way to the woods. Still full of food The only damage was the plastic perch which is not under Warrenty and I fully expected to pay for the part. HOWEVER!!! The Bome Company is sending me the part at no charge. It serves every size bird I feed up to the northern flicker and red-bellied woodpeckers. So I don’t have to have several styles any longer. I have coveted this for years but had to wear out all the others before I could justify the cost. Excellent value! Excellent customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Roxana Brueseke

customer_reviews.title: Best squirrel proof bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: After years of buying bird feeders that would prevent squirrels from raiding the stash this one actually works. The concept is so simple when anything heavier than a small bird gets on or touches the perch the doors for the food close. Another added feature is the doors for the food also close when pigeon and those nasty cow bird Blue Jay's alight on the perch. We have two of these feeders, one is around 3 years old and it is still holding up. They are simple to set up and fill. If you like to feed small birds this is the perfect bird feeder for you.
customer_reviews.author: SJPusateri

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder I've found so far
customer_reviews.text: great service. Bird perch was broken upon arrival and I called the company and they sent me a replacement ASAP! The squirrels have been beating this thing up trying to get to the food. you should see the scratches they've put on it! it is a war zone with them...and they are losing.
customer_reviews.author: DEEVCO

customer_reviews.title: Best Bird Feeder EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. We have hours of enjoyment watching various birds come to visit our feeder. It is a very well built feeder - the best we've ever had. We love watching the squirrels attempt to eat from it only to be frustrated. I wish we bought this years ago. The grandchildren love seeing the birds sail in for a meal. 5 stars is not enough. This is the best feeder we've ever had. My husband thought I was crazy to spend so much on a feeder. NOW he sees what a great product it is, He is very happy with it & is a big fan. He wants another!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Graudons

product_meta.title: Squirrel Buster Plus Squirrel-proof Bird Feeder w/Cardinal Ring and 6 Feeding Ports, 5.1-pound Seed Capacity, Adjustable, Pole-mountable (POLE ADAPTOR SOLD SEPARATELY), Green
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1The Squirrel Buster Plus is a deluxe truly squirrel-proof bird feeder. It holds 3 quarts/5.1 pounds of bird seed. It comes with a Free Cardinal Ring, but other accessories are also available.
feature_bullets: FREE CARDINAL RING to attract Northern Cardinals.
Truly squirrel proof: the weight of an adult squirrel automatically closes the shroud denying access to seed.
Chew proof: all feeder parts exposed to squirrels are made of a special chew-proof material RoxResin.
No tools required: Our feeders are designed to be dismantled by hand into individual components without the use of tools.
Seed ventilation system: our patented seed ventilation system keeps the seed fresh longer attracting more wild Birds.
Weight adjustable: the patented adjustable spring mechanism allows you to control which size birds will feed on your squirrel Buster.
LIFETIME CARE: you only need to buy one of our products, and we will to service your feeder for free for the rest of your life!
NEED FOR CLEARANCE: hang providing an 18-inch/47-cm CLEARANCE on all sides.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,694 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
